questions.text: I find it easy to explain my thoughts clearly in group discussions.
I adjust the way I explain things depending on who I'm speaking to.
I enjoy working with others to achieve shared goals.
I feel comfortable sharing my opinions, even when others disagree.
I often take the lead when organizing group activities or tasks.
I try to stay calm and find solutions when disagreements arise.
I think about how my actions affect others before making decisions.
I quickly adapt when plans change unexpectedly.
I enjoy exploring new tools or methods to improve how I work.
I break large problems into smaller steps to make them easier to handle.
I try to see challenges from different angles before deciding on a solution.
I often find myself questioning whether something could be done better.
I enjoy brainstorming ideas in group settings.
I focus on keeping everyone calm and working together during conflicts.
I make an effort to really understand how others are feeling.
I usually stay productive and focused, even when under pressure.
I prioritize my tasks to make sure I meet deadlines.
I consider the consequences of my decisions before acting.
I seek input from others when making decisions that affect the group.
I actively listen to others without interrupting.
I ask questions to clarify things I don't fully understand.
I regularly make time to connect with people in my field.
I follow up with people I meet to maintain professional relationships.
I set personal goals and track my progress toward achieving them.
I stay focused on my tasks even when I'm working alone.
I adapt my approach when I realize my current strategy isn't working.
I look for ways to support my teammates when they're struggling.
I find myself encouraging others to stay motivated during tough times.
I take responsibility for my decisions, even when things go wrong.
